name: Embassy Suites Miami Airport

reviews.text: This was a really nice place to stay. I was on my way to South America to visit family and I had been told by some friends to stay here as they had done. I must say, it was really convenient to the airport, just a short 5 minute drive on the hotel shuttle.
reviews.title: Really nice place

likes.liked: — Everything was new and the suites were so big
likes.disliked: — The room did not have much of a view because it is at the airport

reviews.text: When I got the the suite, I noticed that it had just been renovated. They had all new furniture, new beds and the room had a beautiful wet bar area with granite top and also the bathroom was very clean. In the morning my whole family (5 of us) enjoyed the breakfast which was very plentiful, with eggs and pancakes for the kids. The staff was pretty friendly too, one of the breakfast helpers noticed that our son said it was his birthday and they made him a special pancake with Happy Birthday written on it and a candle. This is good hotel for anyone stopping in Miami for 1 night or even for longer. I hope we get a chance to go back some day.
reviews.title: Good hotel - no complaints

likes.liked: — multiple services in one price - shuttles and breakfast

reviews.text: I think this was a great hotel and would recommend it highly. I cannot understand why the negative reviews. I would rate is a four star hotel versus three.
reviews.title: no complaints

reviews.text: Our family of four stayed here the night before our cruise. The room was clean and newly decorated with good quality decor. The two rooms were sizeable, the beds were comfortable and clean.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: We were allowed to check in at 12:30 at no additional cost.
reviews.title: worst experience ever in a Embassy suites

likes.disliked: — everything was horrible , dirty rooms, bad customer service,safety hazard, disorganized

reviews.text: After reading all of the reviews we were "scared " to stay at the Embassy Suites Hotel. We were pleasantly surprised! This hotel is above average. The rooms were very nice and clean. (we had our room move 3 times due to no air in the room) The lobby was massive and very very nice. This is a very large hotel. The front desk, hotel staff and everyone there was very helful. (Not at all rude as in the other reviews) The breakfast was wonderful but should stay open until at least 10:00. Location okay. If this resort was located on the beach it would be a 5 star resort!!! The only negative thing about this hotel is the elevators - they are way too slow. There is really no stair access - you have to walk around the hotel to find them. On both sides of the hotel one elevator was down - it doesn't sound like much but a hotel this size it makes things extra slow!! Overall if you have to stay at the airport I would recommend this hotel. The shuttle was great and we really had no problem like the "other reveiws". The manager or assistant manager (his desk is located across from the front desk) on duty was very helpful to us and you can see him walking around the hotel all day long. He asked us several times if everything was okay, etc... At breakfast I even saw him picking up breakfast dishes!!! He might be the reason this hotel is turning around the bad reviews???? Good job!
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised!!!

likes.disliked: — Noise from the planes when at the pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay made us physically sick. My husband and I stayed one nite at this hotel upon our completion of a cruise in October 2007. The hotel looked okay on our initial entry, however, our first room had such a strong odor of mold and mildew, we requested a room change. Our second
reviews.title: mold and mildew made this stay unacceptable

likes.disliked: — the mold, mildew and condition of the property

reviews.text: room was a little better, but still had the mold smell which seemed to worsen when the air was running. The windows were stained and need to be replaced. When we complained about the overwhelming smell of mold, the front desk clerk admitted the hotel has some problems with the smell in some rooms. It is apparent the property has had some renovations. The Elevators are scary- they are slow, old and small. After reading some of the comments on this website, I concluded i needed to share my experience. I actually developed a respiratory infection within days of my stay and had to obtain medical treatment.
reviews.title: Surprisingly solid experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good news about the Hilton Hotels/Embassy Suites policy is that they provide 100% satisfaction or you get your money back. When I complained to Hilton customer service, they refunded my costs. I will never stay at this hotel again, but I will stay at other Embassy Suite
reviews.title: A big plus

reviews.text: hotels.
reviews.title: Great place for a short stopover

likes.liked: — Breakfast, free evening cocktails, the atrium, the pool

reviews.text: I stayed here on business several times because it is cheaper than the other Hilton brand hotels in the area. The hotel itself is dreadful. The room decor is extremely tacky as is the lobby, atrium and all other hotel areas. They claim to be doing a renovation but pictures I saw of the planned changes did not seem that great. The rooms have a microwave and a fridge but no cutlery, plates or glasses to actually eat from. I had to go all the way down to the restaurant to pick these supplies up. They would not give a plate so I had to steal one from breakfast! There are 2 sinks in the bedrooms and bathroom, neither of which worked. The plugs were broken on both meaning I could not shave. The girl at reception seemed totally uninterested when I told her this. The shower did not work correctly - half the water came out from the bath taps.
reviews.title: Awful Hotel

reviews.text: The bedding was basic and the pillows very old and uncomfortable. The room smelt funny. The TV was ancient. Often the elevators did not work correctly. Another problem I had was one morning I needed to pick up a package from them that had been delivered to me. Reception said that I had to go to the security office to pick it up. However the security office is always closed! It took days to get my package.
reviews.title: The hotel from [--] a complete dump. think twice before you stay here

likes.disliked: — Poor Customer Service, Management not availble to assist Guest with concerns.

reviews.text: However the worst is yet to come! One night I arrived very late (about 1:00am in the morning). The guy at reception told me that they could not accommodate me and had given up my room. The excuse he gave me was that they had had some storm damage two nights previously. He said he had arranged accommodation for me at the Sheraton which was about 30 minutes drive away. So I drove to the Sheraton, tried to check in and was told that they also had run out of rooms! I was outraged. I then got sent to the Airport hotel which was another 30 minutes away and very inconvenient. I didn't get to sleep until about 3:00am in the morning after a long flight. I think this is unacceptable especially as I am a Hilton Diamond member. I also happen to know that there were no storms two nights before in Miami!
reviews.title: Worst hotel stay ever

reviews.text: The one redeeming feature about this hotel is the breakfast which is pretty good. Also the hotel is cheap if you pay in full up front, but this is not enough reason to stay here.
reviews.title: Don't expect any type of service at this hotel!

likes.liked: — The complimentary breakfast and evening reception

reviews.title: you get what you pay for
reviews.text: First I must express my disappointment with my Travel Agent for recommending me to this place...I stayed at The Embassey Suites from May 18th to May 20th 2007 and from the moment I check in me first impression of the place was that it was worn and in need of a face lift. Upon checkin I was greeted by a very unfriendly agent who appeared to be very tired and just wanted for this to be her last duty for the day. She asked to see my credit card which was on file, I told her that I wished not for my credit card to be charged and opted to pay cash in full with an additional security deposit she told me that it was not neccessary given that me credit card would not be charge and I can settle at the end of the two day stay. Little and behold on the second night I was complete humilated and embrassed given that Security had locked me out of my room. I went to the Front Desk spoke with a so call Manager named "Karyn" who appeared to be clueless as to what had occurred and expressed to interest in my concern. I again asked her what was the problem given that I was locked out she indicated that they were charging me credit card two hundred dollars a day security..I immediate informed her told her of what her agent said to me upon checkin and paid my bill in full. I told her that I would like to have her General Manager "Juan Carlos Palacious returned a call to me to express my total disatifaction and she said that he cannot be reach she had no contact information at her property for him. I became furious I demanded that he return a call and went to my room escorted by security to open my room door. Karyn left work at 11:36pm on May 19th 2007 and never returned a follow up call. No word from Mr. Palicious as well. Upon entering my room I freaked to find out that not only was the door locked but the room was not clean at 12 midnight. I went back to the Front desk and spoke with Marcos who confirmed that Karyn left and he was the only person on property that I can speak with and we was only an agent..You can imagine what was going through my mind during this time, I ask Marcos to contact his Manager or some senior person and he told me that no one was reachable. I asked Marcos if this was indeed an emergency with a Guest at his hotel what is the process he told be that he would call the revelant athorities and write a report and update his GM when he sees him. I could not believe what I was hearing and became fearful knowing that his hotel did not have a senior person availble to assist guest conerns. I noted the many definciencies with room 7-314 room very moldly, room leaking near the sliding door I jumped out of bed into a pool of water, faucet is leaking in the bathroom, shower is broken, no day service, TV had a black screen unable to view. tile cracked in the bathroom, the furnitures are worn and old, and the staff need a completed training course in customer service and how to handle complains they were completely unresonsive and refuse to take responsiblity for their own ineptidue. This place is a complete waste of money particually when you are paying almost $200.00 a night not worth it at all...The first room that I was assigned was 7-432 which was completely unbearable from the moment you entered the room mold everywhere..I opted to eat breakfast outside of the hotel given that I was concern about the cleaniness of this Hotel. Please note that I tried calling your 800 number to get some help and spoke with Erin in resevation who said that there was nothing she can do and question me as to why Marcos told be to call the 800 number. I asked her for her last name and she said no. I was so furious at this hotel and in total disbelief that there was no Customer Service of any kind anywhere at the Embassy Suites (MIA). I told Marcos that iI wanted a Manager to call me at first light in the morning to speak with them prior to departure and again up to 11am on May 20th 2007 no response from no one...unbeliveable. I then motion to the Front desk and spoke with the Security Manager who said that he was the Manager on duty and I told him my concerns...and asked to speak with the GM he told me that he was not available. I reinterate my conerns and asked him what the [--] is going on in this place with only one Security Officer on duty at the front gate and no other management presence anywhere..he said that he was the way they do things there..I pulled out my business card and told him that I was a Hotel Manager at a world class hotel and told him that if my guest needed assistance with a concern that warrants my attention my staff can reach me without a doubt. When he saw my card he started to act nice.. I also told him that if I needed to reach my chaiman I can reach him without a doubt. i told him that my number one Core value is to "Blow away the Customer" and my staff is impowered to make it happen. My Guest is of utmost importance to me and to have any of my Guest leave unhappy is a major problem. I told him, my staff are impowered to resolve issuses. I suggested that they train these people in customer handling to appreaciate the value of a guest particually when there are other options..I requested the GM information and was given one night credit which was totally unaccepatable and not the response I was looking for. So all of you who are looking for a Hotel close to the Airport think twice about this place and also the security of yourselves. Today I tried calling the GM and again no response....I can also suggest that you hire JDPowers and associates to check your standards if any. I will never take my travel agent advice again..

First off, I've NEVER posted a complaint about any business before. This was one of the worst experiences not just in my travels but in my life. Hotel would not honor a CONFIRMED, PREPAID RESERVATION (!!!)
reviews.title: Incredibly Rude Horrible Treatment- AVOID!

reviews.text: (perhaps they had overbooked?)- Desk Manager K---n T. was basically rude, said "take it up with Expedia" (even though they have a contractual relationship and Embassy Suites was, i was later informed, obligated to comply with the reservation). As if, at Midnight with two children in tow (!), i'm supposed to get a court order forcing them to give me the room for which I was showing documented proof or payment? Amazing attitude of non-responsibility for their own mistake and willingness to leave paying guests in a terrible situation. Told us "sorry, nothing we can (or will) do", wouldn't even make a phone call. sounds like I'm exaggerating this situation but i'm not at all. We had to sleep in the car in a rather sketchy area. So, unless you want to risk a dangerous, cold night without a place to stay, i wouldn't be looking at this place. An unbelievable experience, unbelievable treatment.
reviews.title: Find somewhere else to stay.
horrible experience
reviews.text: We stayed here 3 nights….two before our cruise and one afterwards. This was by far the worst Embassy Suites I have ever been at.

First off when we arrived at the Miami airport around 10:30 we called for a shuttle. I could barely understand the person, but managed to finally figure out where I was supposed to go. We waited outside in the dark, all alone, for over 30 minutes. Tried to call the hotel back a few times but they wouldn’t answer. Finally after about 45 minutes the shuttle arrived, and when I got to the front desk they didn’t have a room for us. This after I had made a reservation in advance and specifically called the hotel directly to tell them we would be arriving late at night and I wanted to be sure I had a non-smoking room held for my family. All they had was smoking rooms or one with a conference table (for in-room interviews) where the living room would normally be. We choose the room with the conference table, so essentially we only had ½ the room we were supposed to as the living room was unusable.
reviews.title: Worst Hotel...Staff rude
Great last minute stay!
reviews.text: This hotel has a nice pool and the staff seemed friendly, but it needs lots of help. The public areas inside the hotel are very dirty, the rooms have a terrible moldy/humid smell that is almost unbearable, and the place needs some serious repair and refurbishment. The sink in the bedroom sprang a leak in the middle of our last night and flooded the carpeting, and we got stuck in one of the elevators once. Plaster was falling off the walls in everywhere, and the kitchen/breakfast area was just gross.

description: All suites mediterranean style hotel featuring 318 spacious two room suites. This 10 story deluxe hotel features complimentary cooked-to-order breakfast daily, 2 hour Manager's Reception nightly, round trip airport transfers and Hilton Honors Points & Miles.
